steps.text: Combine ingredients in a medium bowl and stir.
Once it comes together, use a wet hand to give the dough 20-30 folds. You can also use a stand mixer with a dough hook if preferred.
Cover the bowl with plastic and let it sit in a warm spot for 30 minutes.
After 30 min, build more strength into the dough by grabbing an of dough, stretching it out, and folding back over.
After these stretches and folds, tuck and fold the dough a few more times to shape and stretch the dough into a taught ball.
Wrap the bowl with plastic and set it in a warm place for 2 hours. After the 2 hours dough should have doubled in size.
To prep pans for dough, glug 2 tbsp oil into each pan and smear over the bottom and sides.
Flip the dough onto a floured surface and divide it in half.
Lay half of the dough into each pan and gently press to spread.
Cover pans and allow dough to relax for 30 minutes.
After the 30 minutes, gently stretch and press dough to cover the bottom of the pans.
Cover again and let rise for 45-60 mins.
Preheat a sauce pot over medium heat.
Add oil and garlic.
When garlic is golden and fragrant, add tomato sauce, paste,  salt,  sugar, basil oregano, and stir to combine.
Simmer for about 25 minutes or until thickened.
Preheat oven and pizza stone to 500 F.
Spread cheese over the dough.
Spoon sauce in two thick lines, lengthwise down each dough, leaving the cheese uncovered in the middle and on either side of the lines of the sauce.
Add pepperoni or toppings of choice on top.
Load the pan directly on top of the pizza stone or baking sheet and bake for 16-18 minutes
